headline: Even Permabears Have Portfolios. Where Jeremy Grantham Sees Value Now.
summary: Jeremy Grantham was born toward the tail end of the Great Depression, but has surfed plenty of subsequent booms and busts in his storied investment career.  Barron’s spoke with Grantham, co-founder of Boston-based GMO, on Dec. 23 about the current stock market boom, his favorite investments, and the economic challenges that lie ahead.  What is your stock market forecast for 2026?

content.title: Even Permabears Have Portfolios. Where Jeremy Grantham Sees Value Now.
content.summary: Jeremy Grantham was born toward the tail end of the Great Depression, but has surfed plenty of subsequent booms and busts in his storied investment career.  Barron’s spoke with Grantham, co-founder of Boston-based GMO, on Dec. 23 about the current stock market boom, his favorite investments, and the economic challenges that lie ahead.  What is your stock market forecast for 2026?

headline: 2026 Is a Make-or-Break Year for the AI Trade
summary: The “AI trade”—investing in companies linked to the artificial-intelligence data-center buildout—is about to enter its fourth year, and that brings questions of durability to the fore.  Yes, 2026 is a make-or-break year, and in the end, power supply may be what applies the brakes.  For now, demand for data center hardware from the likes of  Nvidia  and  Micron Technology  remains high, and that will continue at least through the first half of 2026.

content.title: 2026 Is a Make-or-Break Year for the AI Trade
content.summary: The “AI trade”—investing in companies linked to the artificial-intelligence data-center buildout—is about to enter its fourth year, and that brings questions of durability to the fore.  Yes, 2026 is a make-or-break year, and in the end, power supply may be what applies the brakes.  For now, demand for data center hardware from the likes of  Nvidia  and  Micron Technology  remains high, and that will continue at least through the first half of 2026.

headline: Tecnotree Included as a Representative Provider in Gartner® Innovation Insight: AI SOC Agents Accelerate CSP SecOps Transformation
summary: ESPOO, Finland, December 31, 2025--Tecnotree, a global digital platform and services provider for communications service providers (CSPs), today announced that it has been referenced as a Representative Provider alongside Google, Anthropic, Dropzone AI, DRUID, Palo Alto Networks, and Pegasystems in the Gartner® Innovation Insight: "AI SOC Agents Accelerate CSP SecOps Transformation," published in December 2025.

content.title: Tecnotree Included as a Representative Provider in Gartner® Innovation Insight: AI SOC Agents Accelerate CSP SecOps Transformation

headline: These Stocks Are the Market’s Biggest Winners and Losers in 2025
summary: The AI trade broadened out this year, as chip stocks again led the S&P 500 but were joined by the shares of companies tied to building the data centers that will power the technology.  Three of the index’s top 10 performers in 2025 were data storage companies, which are among the main beneficiaries of the hundreds of billions of dollars in pledged spending by the giant AI cloud service providers known as hyperscalers.

content.title: These Stocks Are the Market’s Biggest Winners and Losers in 2025
content.summary: The AI trade broadened out this year, as chip stocks again led the S&P 500 but were joined by the shares of companies tied to building the data centers that will power the technology.  Three of the index’s top 10 performers in 2025 were data storage companies, which are among the main beneficiaries of the hundreds of billions of dollars in pledged spending by the giant AI cloud service providers known as hyperscalers.

headline: Alphabet Stock Can Rise Another 22%, Analyst Says. Here’s Why.
summary: Analysts covering  Alphabet  are getting more excited about the 2026 outlook for the stock as data show artificial intelligence is making Google’s search tools more useful.  Citizens analyst Andrew Boone raised his price target for Alphabet on Wednesday to $385 from $340.  “We view AI search as a tailwind near term for query growth,” Boone wrote in a research note.

content.title: Alphabet Stock Can Rise Another 22%, Analyst Says. Here’s Why.
content.summary: Analysts covering  Alphabet  are getting more excited about the 2026 outlook for the stock as data show artificial intelligence is making Google’s search tools more useful.  Citizens analyst Andrew Boone raised his price target for Alphabet on Wednesday to $385 from $340.  “We view AI search as a tailwind near term for query growth,” Boone wrote in a research note.
